Year\n! style=\"width:20em;\"| Title\n|-\n| 2018\n! scope=\"row\"| \"David Ashley Parker from Powder Springs\"\n|-\n| rowspan=\"2\"| 2019\n! scope=\"row\"| \"After a Few\"\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Tank of Gas and a Radio Song\"\n|-\n| 2020\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Sitting By A Fire\"\n|-\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n*{{official website|http://www.travisdenning.com/}}\n{{authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Denning, Travis}}\n[[Category:1992 births]]\n[[Category:American country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American country guitarists]]\n[[Category:American male singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American male guitarists]]\n[[Category:Country musicians from Georgia (U.S. state)]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:American guitarists]]\n[[Category:Mercury Records artists]]\n[[Category:People from Warner Robins, Georgia]]\n[[Category:Singers from Nashville, Tennessee]]\n[[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:21st-century American guitarists]]\n[[Category:Country musicians from Tennessee]]\n[[Category:21st-century American male singers]]\n[[Category:Singer-songwriters from Georgia (U.S. state)]]\n[[Category:Singer-songwriters from Tennessee]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Dallas_Smith","to":"Dallas Smith"}],"pages":{"4145583":{"pageid":4145583,"ns":0,"title":"Dallas Smith","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian musician}}\n{{About|the Canadian musician|ice hockey player|Dallas Smith (ice hockey)}}\n{{Distinguish|Dallis Smith|Dallas Smythe}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Dallas Smith\n| image           = Dallas_Smith.jpg\n| birth_name      = Dallas Hendry Smith\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|1977|12|4}}\n| birth_place     = [[New Westminster, British Columbia]], Canada\n| spouse = {{marriage|Kristen Smith|2012}}\n| caption         = Smith circa 2011\n| image_size      =\n| origin          = [[Langley, British Columbia (city)|Langley, British Columbia]], Canada\n| instrument      =\n| genre           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Country music|Country]]\n* [[country rock]]\n* [[alternative rock]]\n* [[hard rock]]\n* [[post-grunge]]\n* [[country pop]]\n* [[alternative country]]\n}}\n| occupation      = {{flatlist|\n* Singer\n* songwriter\n}}\n| years_active    = 1999\u2013present\n| label           = {{flatlist|\n* [[Big Loud]]\n* Local Hay\n* [[604 Records|604]]\n* [[Republic Nashville]]\n* Blaster\n}}\n| associated_acts = [[Default (band)|Default]]\n| website         = {{URL|dallassmithmusic.com}}\n}}\n\n'''Dallas Hendry Smith''' (born December 4, 1977) is a Canadian singer and songwriter, who performs both as a solo [[country music]] artist and as lead singer for the [[hard rock]] band [[Default (band)|Default]]. He is currently signed to [[Big Loud Records]]. Smith is the current record holder of most number one hits among all male Canadian artists on ''Billboard''{{'}}s [[Canada Country]] chart, at eleven. With ''[[Side Effects (Dallas Smith album)|Side Effects]]'', Smith also became the first Canadian country artist in the Nielsen BDS era to chart four consecutive number one singles from one album ([[Shania Twain]] charted three consecutive number one hits from her 1997 release ''[[Come On Over]]''), a feat he would then top with his next album, ''[[Timeless (Dallas Smith album)|Timeless]]''.\n\nAt the end of 2012, [[Mediabase]] named Smith the most played Canadian country act and number eight overall at the format.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pdf.mediabase.com/YearEnd12/YearEnd12Canada.pdf |title=Year end |publisher=pdf.mediabase.com |date=2012 |access-date=2019-12-25}}</ref>\n\n==Music career==\n===Early career===\nDallas Smith always had a passion for music growing up. Some of his main influences were [[The Beatles]] and female country singers [[Reba McEntire]] and [[The Judds]]. Due to his shyness, Smith was reluctant to express his musical talent until he made the decision to face his fear and play cover songs with a band consisting of some of his friends. He signed his first record deal when he was 21.<ref>{{cite web|author=Krissie|title=Dallas Smith - December's \"Artist on the Rise|url=http://countrymusicmatters.com/2013/12/dallas-smith-decembers-artist-on-the-rise/|publisher=CMM|access-date=2014-03-12}}</ref>\n\n===1999\u20132009: Default===\n{{Main|Default (band)}}\nBefore his solo career, Smith was the lead singer of multi-platinum band [[Default (band)|Default]], a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[hard rock]]/[[post-grunge]] band from [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]]. Formed in 1999, it continued until 2013. Default's debut 2001 album, ''[[The Fallout (Default album)|The Fallout]]'', achieved instant success due to strong radio play of \"[[Wasting My Time (Default song)|Wasting My Time]]\" and \"[[Deny (Default song)|Deny]]\". In 2002 Default won the [[Juno Award]] for \"Best New Group\". On April 30, 2003, the record achieved a [[platinum album]] [[RIAA certification]], signifying a million records sold.<ref>[https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?table=SEARCH_RESULTS&artist=Default%20&format=ALBUM&go=Search&perPage=50 RIAA Database]</ref> The band also released the album ''[[Elocation]]'' (2003) which was certified gold, ''[[One Thing Remains]]'' (2005) and ''[[Comes and Goes]]'' (2009).\n\n===2011\u20132012: ''Jumped Right In'' and Boys of Fall Tour===\n''[[Jumped Right In]]'' was released on May 22, 2012, via [[604 Records]] under the production of [[Joey Moi]].<ref name=\"chiefmusicmanagement.com\">{{cite news|title=Dallas Smith debut country solo album \"Jumped Right In\" will be released May 22|url=http://chiefmusicmanagement.com/dallas-smith-debut-country-solo-album-jumped-right-in-will-be-released-may-22|access-date=April 5, 2012|newspaper=Chief Music Management|date=March 28, 2012|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131202230615/http://chiefmusicmanagement.com/dallas-smith-debut-country-solo-album-jumped-right-in-will-be-released-may-22|archive-date=December 2, 2013}}</ref> The album features tracks written by Smith along with Moi, [[Rodney Clawson]], [[Craig Wiseman]], [[Dustin Lynch]], [[Chris Tompkins]], Zac Maloy, [[Chad Kroeger]] and more. It peaked at number 19 on the [[Canadian Albums Chart]] and has generated five charted singles on the [[Canadian Hot 100]]. The album was nominated for Country Album of the Year at the 2013 [[Juno Awards of 2013|Juno Awards]] and was also nominated as Album of the Year for the 2013 [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Awards. The album has sold over 100,000 digital singles to date.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.interiordailynews.com/index.php/entertainment/5575-first-country-project-from-dallas-smith-reaches-over-100000-digital-single-sales-from-album-jumped-right-in |title= First County Project |access-date=2013-08-16 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130817073754/http://www.interiordailynews.com/index.php/entertainment/5575-first-country-project-from-dallas-smith-reaches-over-100000-digital-single-sales-from-album-jumped-right-in |archive-date=2013-08-17 }}</ref>\n\nIn November 2012, Smith performed on his first solo tour, co-headlining with [[Chad Brownlee]]. The tour was billed as the Boys of Fall Tour and traveled across Canada, hitting 22 cities. The tour sold out on 20 of its dates, including the Commodore Theatre in [[Vancouver]]. Smith performed at many Canadian country festivals through 2012 and 2013. In March 2013, Smith went on a sold-out Canadian tour with [[Bob Seger]].\n\nStemming from the success of the Boys of Fall Tour, Smith and Brownlee teamed up to create the annual Boys of Fall Charity Golf Tournament and Concert. The tournament took place at the Redwoods Golf Course in [[Langley, British Columbia (city)|Langley, British Columbia]] on August 27, 2013, and was sponsored by the radio station [[CJJR-FM|JRfm]]. Proceeds from the event were donated to Basics for Babies, an organization that assists families coping with the challenges of raising a young infant by providing them with needed food, formula, and diapers. The tourney's fifth year took place on Tuesday, August 22, 2017.\n\n===2013: ''Tippin' Point EP''===\nIn October 2013, Smith signed with [[Republic Nashville]] and released his first American single, \"[[Tippin' Point]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://us1.campaign-archive2.com/?u=1c86c0f2d094175097ac1a0e5&id=c356a441aa&e=9c1f3d9e0c|title=BMLG Goes Pink In Support Of Breast Cancer Awareness}}</ref> It was written by [[Brian Kelley (musician)|Brian Kelley]] and [[Tyler Hubbard]] of [[Florida Georgia Line]] with [[Jaren Johnston]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Foster|first=Ben|title=Canadian Country Star Dallas Smith Signs With Republic Nashville; Releases First Single to iTunes|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/canadian-country-star-dallas-smith-signs-with-republic-nashville-releases-first-single-to-itunes|access-date=October 15, 2013|newspaper=Roughstock|date=October 10, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131018192605/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/canadian-country-star-dallas-smith-signs-with-republic-nashville-releases-first-single-to-itunes|archive-date=October 18, 2013}}</ref> In 2013, Smith was nominated for Male Artist of the Year, Single of the Year and Album of the Year by the [[Canadian Country Music Association]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://topcountry.ca/2013-ccma-awards-nominees-announced/|title=2013 CCMA Awards Nominees|date=2013-07-17|website=Top Country Music {{!}} Country Music News, Charts, Playlists, Videos|language=en-US|access-date=2019-02-01}}</ref> Smith performed on the CCMA broadcast award ceremony, which took place on September 8, 2013.\n\nSmith released an extended play, ''[[Tippin' Point (EP)|Tippin' Point]]'', on March 4, 2014, in the US and Canada. Three singles have been released from the EP so far. The title track was a top 5 single on the Canadian country radio chart and was pronounced the fastest country single to be Gold certified by [[Music Canada]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chiefmusicmanagement.com/dallas-smiths-tippin-point-the-fastest-selling-canadian-country-single/|title=Dallas Smith's \"Tippin Point\" The Fastest Selling Canadian Country Single|access-date=2014-07-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714143801/http://chiefmusicmanagement.com/dallas-smiths-tippin-point-the-fastest-selling-canadian-country-single/|archive-date=2014-07-14|url-status=dead}}</ref> Since then, the single has been certified Platinum in Canada and the \"Tippin' Point\" video was ranked number 1 on [[CMT (Canada)|CMT Canada]]. In the US, the song \"Tippin' Point\" was ranked number 1 on [[Sirius XM Radio|Sirius XM]]'s [[The Highway (Sirius XM)|The Highway]] Hot 45 Countdown and has sold over 120,000 singles. Smith followed up the success of the first single by releasing \"[[Slow Rollin']]\" in March 2014.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Maryanne|title=New Music: Dallas Smith \"Slow Rollin'\"|url=http://www.country1011.com/2014/03/19/new-music-dallas-smith-slow-rollin/|website=Country 101.1|publisher=[[Rogers Media]]|access-date=30 September 2014|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150225025433/http://www.country1011.com/2014/03/19/new-music-dallas-smith-slow-rollin/|archive-date=25 February 2015}}</ref> The track was a top 5 single at Canadian country radio. A third single, \"[[A Girl Like You (Dallas Smith song)|A Girl Like You]]\", was released in June 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dallas Smith releases new single \"A Girl Like You\" |url=http://www.604records.com/604/home/news/dallas-smith/dallas-smith-releases-new-single-girl-you |publisher=[[604 Records]] |access-date=30 October 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141228070532/http://www.604records.com/604/home/news/dallas-smith/dallas-smith-releases-new-single-girl-you |archive-date=28 December 2014 }}</ref>\n\nSmith's single \"Slow Rollin'\" is performed by [[Lady Antebellum]] on the deluxe edition of their album ''[[747 (album)|747]]''.\n\n===2014\u20132017: ''Lifted'' and ''Side Effects''===\nIn 2014, Smith entered a recording studio in [[Nashville]] to record his second full-length studio album with producer [[Joey Moi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/news/dallas-smith-returns-studio-complete-debut-country-album-tippin-point|title=Dallas Smith Returns to Studio to Complete Debut Country Album, \"Tippin' Point\"|date=25 August 2014|work=Nash Country Weekly}}</ref> The album, ''[[Lifted (Dallas Smith album)|Lifted]]'', was released on November 25, 2014. Smith released the first single off the album, \"[[Wastin' Gas]]\",<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tinson|first1=Kayla|title=Dallas Smith's \"Wastin' Gas\" climbs to #1|url=http://topcountry.ca/dallas-smiths-wastin-gas-climbs-1/|access-date=21 January 2015|work=Top Country|publisher=TC Inc|date=19 January 2015}}</ref> on October 28, 2014, followed by album's lead track \"[[Lifted (Dallas Smith song)|Lifted]]\"<ref>{{cite web|title=New Dallas Smith Video For New Canadian Single \"Lifted\"|url=http://bigloudmountain.com/new-dallas-smith-video-for-new-canadian-single-lifted/|publisher=Big Loud Mountain|access-date=9 March 2015|date=9 March 2015}}</ref> and finally \"[[Cheap Seats (song)|Cheap Seats]]\".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Kelly|first1=Corey|title=Dallas Smith \u2013 Cheap Seats|url=http://www.soundcheckentertainment.ca/dallas-smith-cheap-seats/|publisher=Soundcheck Entertainment|access-date=25 August 2015|date=July 1, 2015}}</ref> \"Wastin' Gas\" became Smith's first #1 [[Canada Country]] hit,<ref name=\"Canada Country\"/> as well as his first charting entry on the ''Billboard'' Country Digital Songs and Country Indicator airplay charts in the United States.<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Dallas Smith Chart History (Country Indicator)|url= https://www.billboard.com/music/Dallas-Smith/chart-history/country-indicator |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=May 20, 2020}}{{dead link|date=December 2021|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref><ref name=US-Digital>{{cite magazine|title=Dallas Smith (Country Digital Song Sales)|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/dallas-smith/chart-history/cdt/|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=April 19, 2018}}</ref>\n\nIn 2016, Smith released his third solo album ''[[Side Effects (Dallas Smith album)|Side Effects]]''. The singles released from the album included \"[[Kids with Cars]]\",<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Dallas Smith To Release \"Kids With Cars\"|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/09/37934-dallas-smith-to-release-kids-with-cars|access-date=20 September 2015|work=Roughstock|publisher=Cheri Media|date=September 10, 2015}}</ref> \"[[One Little Kiss]]\",<ref name=\"Urban\">{{cite news|author1=Press Release |title=Smith Makes Urban Connection |url=http://themusicexpress.ca/smith-makes-urban-connection/ |access-date=May 24, 2016|publisher=The Music Express|date=April 28, 2016}}</ref> \"[[Autograph (Dallas Smith song)|Autograph]]\",<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sperounes|first1=Sandra|title=Five things about country star Dallas Smith|url=https://edmontonjournal.com/entertainment/music/five-things-about-country-star-dallas-smith|access-date=13 September 2016|work=[[Calgary Herald]]|publisher=[[Postmedia Network]]|date=September 13, 2016}}</ref> lead title track \"[[Side Effects (Dallas Smith song)|Side Effects]]\"<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kennedy|first1=John R.|title='Side Effects' Gives Dallas Smith His 3rd No. 1 Hit |url=http://www.iheartradio.ca/news/side-effects-gives-dallas-smith-his-3rd-no-1-hit-1.2531142|access-date=April 10, 2017|work=[[iHeartRadio]] |date=April 10, 2017}}</ref> and \"[[Sky Stays This Blue]]\".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Taylor|first1=Andrea|title=[WATCH] Dallas Smith Debuts Video for 'Sky Stays This Blue' Starring His 3-Year Old Daughter!|url=http://www.cisnfm.com/2017/06/18/watch-dallas-smith-debuts-video-for-sky-stays-this-blue-starring-his-3-year-old-daughter/|access-date=July 5, 2017|work=[[CISN-FM]]|date=June 18, 2017}}{{Dead link|date=January 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> In September 2016, Smith also joined [[Keith Urban]] for the Canadian leg of his [[Ripcord World Tour]].<ref name=\"Urban\"/>\n\n===2018\u20132020: ''The Fall'' EP and ''Timeless''===\nIn March 2019, Smith released his EP ''[[The Fall (EP)|The Fall]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Fall - EP by Dallas Smith|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/the-fall-ep/1454055652|website=[[Apple Music]] (CA)|publisher=[[Apple Inc]]|access-date=25 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=4562|title=Dallas Smith Releases 'The Fall'|date=22 March 2019|website=Complete Country|access-date=6 August 2020|archive-date=6 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200806192928/https://www.completecountry.ca/article.php?article_id=4562|url-status=dead}}</ref> The EP featured four straight #1 singles, \"[[Make 'Em Like You]]\",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://frontporchmusic.ca/music/dallas-smiths-make-em-like-you/|title=Dallas Smith's Latest Single \u2013 \"Make 'Em Like You\"|date=July 26, 2018|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=October 22, 2020}}</ref> \"[[Rhinestone World]]\",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/listen-dallas-smith-debuts-rhinestone-world-1.8576730|title=LISTEN: Dallas Smith Debuts 'Rhinestone World'|date=November 23, 2018|first=John R|last=Kennedy|work=[[IHeartRadio#Canada|iHeartRadio.ca]]|publisher=[[Bell Media]]|access-date=October 22, 2020}}</ref> \"[[Drop (Dallas Smith song)|Drop]]\",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bclocalnews.com/entertainment/dallas-smith-drops-eighth-no-1-single/|title=Dallas Smith drops eighth No. 1 single|date=September 4, 2019|publisher=BC Local News|access-date=December 29, 2019|archive-date=December 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191229163009/https://www.bclocalnews.com/entertainment/dallas-smith-drops-eighth-no-1-single/|url-status=dead}}</ref> and \"[[Timeless (Dallas Smith song)|Timeless]]\".<ref>{{cite web|first=John R|last=Kennedy|url= https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/watch-dallas-smith-shares-timeless-video-1.10408067|title=WATCH: Dallas Smith Shares 'Timeless' Video|work=[[IHeartRadio#Canada|iHeartRadio.ca]]|publisher=[[Bell Media]]|date=January 9, 2020}}</ref><ref name=\"Canada Country\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/dallas-smith/chart-history/ccw/ |title=Dallas Smith Chart History (Canada Country) |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=December 5, 2020}}</ref> Smith co-headlined the Friends Don't Let Friends Tour Alone Tour with [[Dean Brody]] across Canada in the Fall of 2020.<ref>{{cite web |title=Dean Brody Releases Anticipated EP, Black Sheep, and new single in Advance of Fall Tour |work=Open Road Recordings |url=https://openroadrecordings.com/news/dean-brody-releases-anticipated-ep-black-sheep-and-new-single-in-advance-of-fall-tour/ |access-date=April 22, 2020 |language=en |archive-date=September 26, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200926115822/https://openroadrecordings.com/news/dean-brody-releases-anticipated-ep-black-sheep-and-new-single-in-advance-of-fall-tour/ |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Dean Brody's New Single, New Album and New Tour|first=Randy|last=Owen|url=https://www.country1011.com/2019/08/21/dean-brodys-new-single-new-album-and-new-tour/|work=101.1 Country|publisher=[[Rogers Media]]|date=August 21, 2019}}</ref>\n\nIn July 2020, a [[Nielsen Music]] study found Smith to be the sixth-highest played Canadian artist on domestic radio in the first half of 2020, ahead of [[Drake (musician)|Drake]] and [[Chad Brownlee]], and slightly behind [[Virginia to Vegas]] and [[Justin Bieber]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/9417354/nielsen-music-mrc-data-midyear-charts-canada-2020|first=Karen|last=Bliss|title= The Weeknd Tops Nielsen Music/MRC Data Midyear Charts Across Canada|date=13 July 2020|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=6 August 2020}}</ref>\n\nSmith's fourth studio album, ''[[Timeless (Dallas Smith album)|Timeless]]'' was released on August 28, 2020, and contains all previously released material from ''The Fall'', as well as the singles, \"[[Like a Man (Dallas Smith song)|Like a Man]]\"<ref>{{cite web|first=John R|last=Kennedy|url=https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/listen-dallas-smith-shares-new-song-like-a-man-1.11504510|title=LISTEN: Dallas Smith Shares New Song 'Like A Man'|work=[[IHeartRadio#Canada|iHeartRadio.ca]]|publisher=[[Bell Media]]|date=April 3, 2020}}</ref> and \"[[Some Things Never Change (Dallas Smith song)|Some Things Never Change]]\".<ref>{{cite news|title=Dallas Smith Releases New Single \"Some Things Never Change (feat. HARDY)\"|url=https://nowandthenmagazine.com/country-now-and-then/blog/dallas-smith-releases-new-single-some-things-never-change-feat-hardy|access-date=October 22, 2020 |work=Now and Then Magazine}}</ref><ref name=\"Timeless\">{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|url=https://etcanada.com/news/676612/dallas-smith-announces-new-album-timeless-reveals-tracklisting/|title=Dallas Smith Announces New Album 'Timeless', Reveals Tracklisting|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|publisher=[[Corus Entertainment]]|date=August 6, 2020|access-date=August 6, 2020|archive-date=September 3, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200903200019/https://etcanada.com/news/676612/dallas-smith-announces-new-album-timeless-reveals-tracklisting/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In November 2020, Smith released his first Christmas single \"Classic\".<ref>{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|url=https://etcanada.com/news/722840/dallas-smith-drops-music-video-for-original-christmas-song-classic/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201209182946/https://etcanada.com/news/722840/dallas-smith-drops-music-video-for-original-christmas-song-classic/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 9, 2020|title=Dallas Smith Drops Music Video For Original Christmas Song 'Classic'|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=December 9, 2020}}</ref>\n\n===2021\u2013present: Self-titled album and Some Things Never Change Tour===\nIn August 2021, Smith signed a global recording deal with [[Big Loud Records]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/9609862/dallas-smith-signs-worldwide-deal-big-loud-records/|title=Canadian Country Star Dallas Smith Signs Worldwide Deal With Big Loud Records |publisher=Billboard |access-date=2021-08-04}}</ref> Along with Big Loud, and producer Scott Cooke, Smith launched the joint venture Local Hay Records which signed [[Shawn Austin]] as their flagship artist.<ref>{{cite web|url= \nhttps://www.fyimusicnews.ca/articles/2021/08/12/music-news-digest-aug-12-2021|title=Music News Digest, Aug. 12, 2021|first=Kerry|last=Doole|work=FYI Music News|date=August 12, 2021}}</ref> In September 2021, Smith hosted and headlined the \"Lifted Hotel Festival\" in [[Vancouver, British Columbia]], with all proceeds from the event going towards his organization, the Lifted Dallas Smith Charitable Foundation which supports mental health. Other featured performers included Austin, [[Jojo Mason]], [[Andrew Hyatt]], and Kelly Prescott.<ref>{{cite web |title=Dallas Smith announces an exclusive safe concert experience in support of mental health \u2013 the Lifted Hotel Festival presented by SiriusXM Canada |url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2021/07/11/dallas-smith-announces-an-exclusive-safe-concert-experience-in-support-of-mental-health-the-lifted-hotel-festival-presented-by-siriusxm-canada/|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|website=Canadian Beats Media|date=July 11, 2021}}</ref> In November 2021, Smith announced his headlining Some Things Never Change Tour, which ran in early 2022 and included [[James Barker Band]], [[Meghan Patrick]], [[Jojo Mason]], and [[Shawn Austin]] among the opening acts.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dallas Smith has announced The Some Things Never Change 2022 Tour and debuted his new single \"Hide from a Broken Heart\" at a special performance on CCCMA Awards Show|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2021/11/29/dallas-smith-has-announced-the-some-things-never-change-2022-tour-and-debuted-his-new-single-hide-from-a-broken-heart-at-a-special-performance-on-oh-cccma-awards-show/|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=November 29, 2021}}</ref> \n\nSmith released \"[[Hide from a Broken Heart]]\" as his first global single on Big Loud on November 29, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://country104.com/event/6500/dallas-smith-2022-tour/|title=Dallas Smith Some Things Never Change Tour 2022|work=Country 104|publisher=[[Corus Entertainment|Corus Media]]|access-date=November 30, 2021}}</ref> Smith debuted the song at the [[2021 Canadian Country Music Awards]] that day, where he won Entertainer of the Year, Male Artist of the Year, Single of the Year for \"[[Like a Man (Dallas Smith song)|Like a Man]]\", and best selling Canadian album for ''[[Timeless (Dallas Smith album)|Timeless]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ctvnews.ca/mobile/entertainment/dallas-smith-named-entertainer-of-the-year-takes-three-trophies-at-ccma-awards-1.5686673|title=Dallas Smith named entertainer of the year, takes three trophies at CCMA Awards|author1=Melissa Couto Zuber|author2=Noushin Ziafati|publisher=[[CTV News]]|date=November 29, 2021}}</ref> He then featured on the [[Josh Ramsay]] single \"[[Best of Me (Josh Ramsay song)|Best of Me]]\" in February 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2022/02/27/josh-ramsay-front-man-for-marianas-trench-has-jumped-genres-and-released-his-single-best-of-me-feat-dallas-smith/|title=Josh Ramsay, front man for Marianas Trench, has jumped genres and released his single \"Best of Me\" (Feat. Dallas Smith)|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|date=February 27, 2022|work=Canadian Beats Media}}</ref> In June 2022, Smith released the single \"[[One Too]]\" with fellow Canadian country singer [[MacKenzie Porter]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bigloudmanagement.com/dallas-smith-mackenzie-porter-deliver-a-one-too-hit-available-everywhere-now-5-27/|title=DALLAS SMITH & MACKENZIE PORTER DELIVER A \"ONE TOO\" HIT AVAILABLE EVERYWHERE NOW (5/27)|work=[[Big Loud Management]]|date=May 27, 2022|access-date=June 10, 2022|archive-date=June 30, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220630032835/https://bigloudmanagement.com/dallas-smith-mackenzie-porter-deliver-a-one-too-hit-available-everywhere-now-5-27/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://countrynow.com/exclusive-premiere-dallas-smith-releases-music-video-for-one-too-with-mackenzie-porter/|title=Exclusive Premiere: Dallas Smith Releases Music Video For 'One Too' With MacKenzie Porter|first=Melinda|last=Lorge|date=June 22, 2022|work=Country Now|access-date=August 15, 2022}}</ref> He was subsequently named Male Artist of the Year and won the Fans' Choice at the [[2022 Canadian Country Music Awards]].<ref name=\"TTCA\"/> In January 2023, Smith released the single \"[[Singing in a Beer]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bigloudrecords.com/chart-topping-country-music-star-dallas-smith-serves-up-singing-in-a-beer-out-today/|title=Chart-Topping Country Music Star Dallas Smith Serves Up \"Singing in a Beer,\" Out Today|date=January 27, 2023|work=[[Big Loud Records]]|access-date=January 29, 2023|archive-date=January 30, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230130042834/https://bigloudrecords.com/chart-topping-country-music-star-dallas-smith-serves-up-singing-in-a-beer-out-today/|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song was included on his self-titled fifth studio album ''[[Dallas Smith (album)|Dallas Smith]]'', which was released on October 27, 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://musicrow.com/2023/09/dallas-smith-announces-self-titled-fifth-studio-album/|title= Dallas Smith Announces Self-Titled Fifth Studio Album|first=Steven|last=Boero|date=September 15, 2023|work=Music Row|access-date=September 23, 2023}}</ref> Smith released two instant gratification tracks \"[[Fixer Upper (Dallas Smith song)|Fixer Upper]]\" and \"CRZY\" alongside the opening of pre-orders for his self-titled album.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://roughstock.com/news/2023/09/46428-dallas-smith-set-to-release-self-titled-big-loud-records-debut-october-27-2023|title=Dallas Smith Set To Release Self-Titled Big Loud Records Debut October 27, 2023|first=Matt|last=Bjorke|date=September 29, 2023|work=Roughstock|access-date=October 4, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/dallas-smiths-new-single-fixer-upper/|title=Dallas Smith's New Single \"Fixer Upper\": A Heartfelt Journey of Self-Work in Relationships|date=September 29, 2023|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=October 4, 2023}}</ref> The album's first track, \"[[Use Me (Dallas Smith song)|Use Me]]\", became its fifth single to Canadian country radio, and was released to radio formats in Australia and the United Kingdom as well.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2024/04/01/dallas-smith-continues-his-global-rise-sets-grand-ole-opry-debut-for-june-12/|title=DALLAS SMITH CONTINUES HIS GLOBAL RISE & SETS GRAND OLE OPRY DEBUT FOR JUNE 12|date=April 1, 2024|first=Jenna|last=Melanson|work=Canadian Beats Media|access-date=June 29, 2024}}</ref>\n\nIn October 2023, it was announced that Smith will take his first acting role, appearing alongside [[Allan Hawco]] and [[Charlie Gillespie]] in ''Soul's Road'', the forthcoming debut film of music video director Joel Stewart.<ref>David Friend, [https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/country-singer-dallas-smith-to-make-acting-debut-with-edmonton-shot-souls-road/article_50a85dfd-7a5f-5390-8f46-9535e627528c.html \"Country singer Dallas Smith to make acting debut with Edmonton-shot 'Soul's Road'\"]. ''[[Toronto Star]]'', October 7, 2023.</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nSmith married his longtime girlfriend Kristen in 2012 and the couple has two daughters together.<ref>{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|url=https://etcanada.com/news/716679/dallas-smith-and-wife-kristen-welcome-baby-girl-everyn-she-is-perfect/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201123154903/https://etcanada.com/news/716679/dallas-smith-and-wife-kristen-welcome-baby-girl-everyn-she-is-perfect/|url-status=dead|archive-date=November 23, 2020|title=Dallas Smith And Wife Kristen Welcome Baby Girl Everyn: 'She Is Perfect'|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|publisher=[[Corus Entertainment]]|date=November 23, 2020}}</ref> He also has a son from a previous marriage.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/brett-kissel-dallas-smith-open-up-about-fatherhood-1.1981153|title=Brett Kissel, Dallas Smith Open Up About Fatherhood|first=John R.|last=Kennedy|date=October 2, 2016|work=[[IHeartRadio Canada|iHeart Canada]]}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{main|Dallas Smith discography}}\n*''[[Jumped Right In]]'' (2012)\n*''[[Lifted (Dallas Smith album)|Lifted]]'' (2014)\n*''[[Side Effects (Dallas Smith album)|Side Effects]]'' (2016)\n*''[[Timeless (Dallas Smith album)|Timeless]]'' (2020)\n*''[[Dallas Smith (album)|Dallas Smith]]'' (2023)\n\n==Awards and nominations==\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Kevin_Skinner","to":"Kevin Skinner"}],"pages":{"23636724":{"pageid":23636724,"ns":0,"title":"Kevin Skinner","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer-songwriter}}\n{{for|the New Zealand rugby player|Kevin Skinner (rugby union)}}\n\n{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2016}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n|image =Kevin Skinner.jpg\n|caption = Skinner performing in 2009\n|background = solo_singer\n|name =Kevin Skinner\n|birth_name = Patrick Kevin Skinner\n|birth_date  = {{birth date and age|1974|2|25}}\n|birth_place = [[McCracken County, Kentucky]]\n|Birth_place = \n|origin = [[Mayfield, Kentucky|Mayfield]], Kentucky, US\n|occupation = Singer, songwriter, farmer\n|instrument = Vocals, guitar\n|label = Cypress Tree\n|years_active = 2009\u2013present\n|genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[country rock]], pop, rock\n|website = \n}}\n\n'''Patrick Kevin Skinner'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.familytreelegends.com/records/12252?c=search&first=Kevin&last=Skinner&spelling=Exact&8_year=1974&8_month=0&8_day=0&4=&9=&11=&SubmitSearch.x=0&SubmitSearch.y=0&SubmitSearch=Submit |title=Kentucky Birth Index, 1911\u20131999 |publisher=Familytreelegends.com |date=February 25, 1974 |access-date=2010-06-09}}</ref> (born February 25, 1974) is an American [[country music]] singer from the [[Jackson Purchase]] region of [[Kentucky]]. He is the winner of the [[America's Got Talent (season 4)|fourth season]] of ''[[America's Got Talent]]''.\n\n== Early life and career ==\nSkinner is from the Dublin community of [[Graves County, Kentucky|Graves County]], [[Kentucky]], and started playing the guitar when he was 12 years old. He has been playing, writing, and singing ever since he learned the art of music from his musician father, Joe, who is a fan of [[Hank Williams]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} Skinner is divorced and has two children, a daughter and a son. He has worked as a chicken catcher for several years and claims to have caught with his friends up to 60,000 chickens in one night.\n\n== ''America's Got Talent'' ==\n\n=== Audition ===\nSkinner performed in a live audition on the August 4, 2009 episode of ''[[America's Got Talent]]''. He became a fan favorite in the show after his performance of [[Garth Brooks]]' \"[[If Tomorrow Never Comes]]\" while strumming his guitar. Judges Piers Morgan, Sharon Osbourne, and David Hasselhoff all voted \"Yes\", sending him to the Vegas Round.\n\n=== Vegas Round ===\nSkinner then appeared without performing in the Vegas Round. His audition was strong enough for the judges to send him to the Quarterfinals in Episode 411.\n\n=== Quarterfinals ===\nHis Week 1 Quarterfinals performance in Episode 413 consisted of singing Bob Dylan's \"Make You Feel My Love\" while playing the guitar. Kevin received enough votes to be sent to the Semifinals in Episode 414 instead of Mosaic.\n\n=== Semifinals ===\nThe Week 1 Semifinals performance in Episode 421 consisted of Skinner guitar playing and singing \"Always On My Mind\" by [[Brenda Lee]]. Piers Morgan gave him a standing ovation, saying that singing from the heart and soul with real, raw emotion is the whole story about him while the two of them were both teary-eyed as well as the audience, in which Kevin was reminded that he had the ability to move an audience in a way that Piers never saw on AGT before concluding that Kevin is one of his favorites to win the season.\n\nIn the end, Kevin received enough votes to be sent to the Finals in Episode 422 instead of Acrodunk basketball trampoline dance group.\n\n=== Finals ===\nLater in the Finals, Skinner's performance in Episode 425 consisted of singing his rendition of Aerosmith's \"I Don't Want to Miss a Thing\" while playing his guitar and having a backup band and vocals.\n\nJudge Piers said the rendition wasn't perfect and had a missed odd note with little flattened places, but described the moment as the point of Skinner's journey as a \"rough diamond\", needing professional training. But remembering the words on how Hasselhoff described Skinner, Piers said that he was what the show was created for while being unemployed and catching chickens the past year at that time. But despite those obstacles, it was a better way for America itself to get out of its recession and have Skinner compete in the show.\n\nEven though Sharon said that he doesn't have the best voice in the contest, she reminded Kevin that he does not need to sound perfect while describing him as one of the greatest and unique icons, similar to [[Johnny Cash]], [[Bob Dylan]], [[Mick Jagger]] and [[Lou Reed]], all of whom did not need to have the perfect voices but are all such unique individuals.\n\nThe judges once again all gave him standing ovations.\n\n=== Finale ===\nKevin Skinner received enough votes to be included in the Top 5 in Episode 426 instead of Drew Stevyns. Kevin was revealed to have competed in first place in the competition that same night, in front of [[Barbara Padilla]] who was runner up, [[Recycled Percussion]] in third place, [[The Texas Tenors]] in fourth, and The Voices of Glory in fifth, winning one million dollars and a headline show in Las Vegas.\n\n=== Trivia ===\nDuring AGT's 10 Year Anniversary Special on July 29, 2015, Piers Morgan stated that Kevin Skinner was his favorite act.\n\n=== Performances/results ===\n{|class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! Week\n! Theme\n! Song choice\n! Original artist\n! Performance order\n! Result\n|-\n| Audition\n| N/A\n| \"[[If Tomorrow Never Comes]]\"\n| [[Garth Brooks]]\n| N/A\n| Safe\n|-\n| Vegas Verdicts\n| Male Singers\n| N/A\n| N/A\n| N/A\n| Safe\n|-\n| Top 48\n| Group 1\n| \"[[Make You Feel My Love]]\"\n| [[Bob Dylan]]\n| 11\n| Safe\n|-\n| Top 20\n| Group 1\n| \"[[Always on My Mind]]\"\n| [[Brenda Lee]]\n| 10\n| Safe\n|-\n| Top 10\n| N/A\n| \"[[I Don't Wanna Miss a Thing]]\"\n| [[Aerosmith]]\n| 9\n| '''Winner'''\n|}\n\n=== Post-''Talent'' ===\nKevin received the $1&nbsp;million prize, which was put into an annuity so it will be paid out over 40 years, and a headline show in Las Vegas, premiering in October 2009 and hosted by [[Jerry Springer]]. He performed \"If Tomorrow Never Comes\" on ''[[The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien]]'' on September 17, 2009, and in October of that year, he performed on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'' and later on ''[[Live with Kelly and Ryan]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tv.com/the-tonight-show-with-conan-obrien/megan-fox-louis-c.k.-kevin-skinner/episode/1295088/summary.html |title=Megan Fox, Louis C.K., Kevin Skinner Season Episode Guide on |publisher=Tv.com |date=December 1, 2009 |access-date=2010-06-09}}</ref>\n\n== Career ==\n\n=== ''Long Ride'' (2010\u2013present) ===\nHis debut CD, \"Long Ride\" was released on his namesake Saint Patrick's Day, March 17, 2010. The album was released online six months later on September 14.<ref>{{cite web |title=America's Got Talent Winner Kevin Skinner Plans Debut Album |url=http://www.antimusic.com/news/10/sep/01Americas_Got_Talent_Winner_Kevin_Skinner_Plans_Debut_Album.shtml |website=Anti Music |access-date=11 February 2023}}</ref>\n\n== Discography ==\n\n=== Albums ===\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! rowspan=\"2\"| Year\n! rowspan=\"2\"| Album\n! colspan=\"2\"| Peak positions\n|- style=\"font-size:smaller;\"\n! style=\"width:45px;\"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]\n! style=\"width:45px;\"| [[Billboard 200|US]]\n|-\n| 2010\n| ''Long Ride''\n{{smalldiv|\n* Release: <br />US: March 17, 2010<br />iTunes: September 14, 2010\n* Label: Cypress Tree}}\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"| \u2014\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"| \u2014\n|-\n| 2011\n| ''Kevin Skinner: Live And Unplugged''\n{{smalldiv|\n* Release: <br />US: May 30, 2011}}\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"| \u2014\n| style=\"text-align:center;\"| \u2014\n|-\n| style=\"text-align:center;\" colspan=\"8\"| <small>\"\u2014\" denotes the album did not chart.</small>\n|}\n\n===Singles===\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! Year\n! Single\n! Album\n|-\n| 2010\n| \"Like It's the Last Goodbye\"\n| ''Long Ride''\n|}\n\n=== Music videos ===\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|-\n! Year\n! Video\n! Director\n|-\n| 2010\n| \"Like It's the Last Goodbye\"\n| [[John Lloyd Miller]]\n|}\n\n== References ==\n{{reflist}}\n\n==External links==\n{{Portal|Biography}}\n*{{Discogs artist}}\n{{clear}}\n\n{{s-start}}\n{{succession box|title=''[[America's Got Talent]]''  winner|before=[[Neal E. Boyd]]|after=[[Michael Grimm (singer)|Michael Grimm]]\n|years=[[America's Got Talent (season 4)|Season 4]] (Summer 2009)}}\n{{s-end}}\n\n{{America's Got Talent}}\n\n{{authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Skinner, Kevin}}\n[[Category:1974 births]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:People from Mayfield, Kentucky]]\n[[Category:Country musicians from Kentucky]]\n[[Category:America's Got Talent winners]]\n[[Category:American country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American male singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Singer-songwriters from Kentucky]]\n[[Category:21st-century American guitarists]]\n[[Category:Guitarists from Kentucky]]\n[[Category:American male guitarists]]\n[[Category:21st-century American male singers]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"A_Thousand_Horses","to":"A Thousand Horses"}],"pages":{"45147277":{"pageid":45147277,"ns":0,"title":"A Thousand Horses","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = A Thousand Horses\n| image           = [[File:ATH-Bloomington-17.jpg|frameless|center|A Thousand Horses performing in Bloomington, IL on January 16, 2015. Photo credit: Chance Edwards]]\n| image_size      = 260px\n| landscape       = <!-- yes, if wide image, otherwise leave blank -->\n| alt             =\n| caption         = A Thousand Horses in 2016\n| alias           =\n| origin          = [[Nashville, Tennessee]]\n| genre           = {{hlist|\n[[Country music|Country]] |[[country rock]]<ref name=\"allmusic\">{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/a-thousand-horses-mn002534031/biography|title=A Thousand Horses biography|last=Monger|first=James Christopher|work=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=4 April 2017}}{{Dead link|date=August 2021 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>|\n[[Southern rock]]<ref name=\"allmusic\"/>}}\n| years_active    = 2010\u2013present\n| label           = [[Nashville Harbor Records & Entertainment|Nashville Harbor]], Highway Sound\n| current_members = Michael Hobby<br />Graham DeLoach<br />Bill Satcher\n| past_members = Zach Brown\n}}\n'''A Thousand Horses''' is an American [[country music]] band formed in 2010 in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. The band is composed of Michael Hobby (lead vocals), Bill Satcher (lead guitar), and Graham Deloach (bass and vocals); Zach Brown (guitar, vocals) was also a member until leaving in 2023. Their first [[extended play|EP]], ''A Thousand Horses'', was released under [[Interscope Records]] in 2010. In 2014, the band signed with [[Republic Nashville]] of [[Big Machine Label Group]] and released its first single \"[[Smoke (A Thousand Horses song)|Smoke]]\", which set a record for the highest debut by a new act when it opened at number 28 on the Country Aircheck radio chart.<ref name=\"roughstock1\">{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=A Thousand Horses' \"Smoke\" Makes Radio History|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/01/32298-thousand-horses-smoke-makes-radio-history/|accessdate=January 26, 2015|work=Roughstock|date=January 23, 2015}}</ref>\n\n==Biography==\nMichael Hobby and Bill Satcher grew up in [[Newberry, South Carolina]], where they began writing songs at the age of 15. Satcher's cousin and [[Savannah, Georgia]], native Graham DeLoach joined the duo soon after. A friend eventually introduced Atlanta native Zach Brown, and A Thousand Horses was formed. The name \"A Thousand Horses\" came from a song on their first EP.<ref name=\"10questions\">{{cite web|author= |url=http://focusonthe615.com/2012/02/09/10-questions-with-a-thousand-horses/ |title=10 Questions With A Thousand Horses |publisher=FOCUS on the 615 |date=February 9, 2012 |access-date=July 13, 2015}}</ref> They enjoy writing their own original songs, but they occasionally collaborate with other writers around Nashville. They have toured nationwide and released their full-length album ''[[Southernality]]'' on January 21, 2015.\n\n===''Bridges''===\nTheir \"deluxe EP\", ''Bridges'', was released on June 2, 2017,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1782216/a-thousand-horses-evolve-with-bridges/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170602225527/http://www.cmt.com/news/1782216/a-thousand-horses-evolve-with-bridges/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 2, 2017|title=A Thousand Horses Evolve with Bridges|work=CMT News|access-date=July 5, 2017}}</ref> with [[Nashville Harbor Records & Entertainment]]. Producing the new CD with [[Dann Huff]] and [[Corey Crowder]], the band vowed to keep their unique sound intact. One of the featured songs on the record is a live version of their breakthrough hit \"Smoke\" recorded in [[Printer's Alley]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/a-thousand-horses-plot-return-with-new-release-bridges-127085/|title=A Thousand Horses Plot Return With New Release 'Bridges'|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=July 5, 2017}}</ref>\n\n===''Southernality''===\nReleased June 9, 2015, ''[[Southernality]]'' is A Thousand Horses' debut album, released by [[Republic Nashville]]. The first single, \"[[Smoke (A Thousand Horses song)|Smoke]]\", has charted on [[Country Airplay]] and [[Hot Country Songs]], reaching number one on the former chart, making A Thousand Horses the first country group to chart a number-one debut single since the [[Zac Brown Band]]'s \"[[Chicken Fried]]\" reached number one in December 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/song/a-thousand-horses/6438813/smoke|title=Smoke|date=|publisher=Billboard|access-date=July 13, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6583139/chart-highlights-taylor-swift-ties-record-as-bad-blood-hits-pop|title=Chart Highlights: Taylor Swift Ties Record as 'Bad Blood' Hits Pop Songs Top 10|last=Trust|first=Gary|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=June 1, 2015|access-date=June 2, 2015}}</ref> Reviews have been generally positive commending their smooth vocals, lyrics, and blend of country and rock.<ref name=\"smokeinterview\">{{cite web|url=http://94country.com/2014/a-thousand-horses-smoke-song-review/|title=A Thousand Horses \"Smoke\" Song Review &#124; The Big 94.5 Country|date=|publisher=94country.com|author=|access-date=July 13, 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714054937/http://94country.com/2014/a-thousand-horses-smoke-song-review/|archivedate=2015-07-14}}</ref> The album's second single, \"[[(This Ain't No) Drunk Dial]]\", was released to country radio on June 29, 2015. The album's third single, the title track, was released to country radio on February 29, 2016.\n\n===''A Thousand Horses''===\n{{quote box|quote=\"A high-energy hybrid of classic rock and bluesy country with enough soul flavor to resurrect the sound of American greats...\"|source=Rolling Stone, 2014, ''Rolling Stone'' website.<ref name=\"rollingreview\"/>|width=250px}}\n\nTheir debut E.P., ''A Thousand Horses'', was released on August 17, 2010, under [[Republic Nashville]]. It was recorded in six days in [[Silver Lake, Los Angeles|Silver Lake, California]], with producer [[Dave Cobb]].\n\nThe song \"Suicide Eyes\" from the E.P. was featured in the movie ''[[Footloose (2011 film)|Footloose]]'' starring [[Kenny Wormald]] and [[Julianne Hough]]. The director, Craig Brewer, found the song and knew that it fit the vibe for the movie.<ref name=\"10questions\"/>\n\nFor their performance at the Austin City Limits festival in 2014, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' hailed the band as the best up-and-comer, praising their \"undeniable energy and stage presence [and] their live performance\".<ref name=\"rollingreview\">{{cite web|last=Edwards |first=Gavin |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/austin-city-limits-2014-country-music-performances-20141007/best-up-and-comer-a-thousand-horses-20141007/ |title=Best Up-and-Comer: A Thousand Horses - Austin City Limits 2014's Standout Performances |publisher=Rolling Stone |date=October 7, 2014 |access-date=July 13, 2015}}</ref>\n\nZach Brown quit the band in 2023 to spend more time with family. A year later, the other three members released a new album titled ''The Outside'' on Highway Sound Records.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-album-reviews/a-thousand-horses-the-outside-review-1235083065/ | title=A Thousand Horses Have Stopped Chasing Country Radio Hits. It Was a Good Decision | publisher=Rolling Stone | date=August 19, 2024 | accessdate=August 22, 2024 | author=Joseph Hudak}}</ref>\n\n===Influences===\nA Thousand Horses self-identifies as a hybrid of English rock, country, American rock, soul, and blues. Their sound mimics [[Lynyrd Skynyrd]], the [[Allman Brothers]], the [[Black Crowes]], and the [[Rolling Stones]] in the context of modern country. Hobby's songwriting is rooted in such songwriters as [[Dwight Yoakam]], [[Tom Petty]], and [[Noel Gallagher]].<ref name=\"athwebsite\">{{cite web|url=http://www.athousandhorses.com/ |title=Official Site |publisher=A Thousand Horses |date= |access-date=July 13, 2015}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Alli_Walker","to":"Alli Walker"}],"pages":{"76944017":{"pageid":76944017,"ns":0,"title":"Alli Walker","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|Canadian country musician and model}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name            = Alli Walker\n| image           = Alli Walker.jpg\n| caption         = Walker performing at Toronto's Festival of Beer in 2024\n| image_size      = \n| background      = solo_singer\n| birth_date      = {{Birth based on age as of date|29|2019|10|25}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.alive.com/lifestyle/alli-walker-music-with-a-conscience/|title=Alli Walker: Music With a Conscience|first=Carim\u00e9|last=Lane|work=[[Alive (magazine)|Alive]]|date=October 25, 2019|access-date=September 12, 2024}}</ref>\n| birth_name      = \n| birth_place     = \n| alias           = \n| origin          = [[Summerside, Prince Edward Island]], Canada\n| instrument      = Bagpipes, drums, guitar, piano, vocals\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country rock]]}}\n| occupation      = Singer, songwriter, model, multi-instrumentalist\n| years_active    = 2009-present\n| label           = Records Nashville \n| website         = {{official|https://www.alliwalker.com/}}\n}}\n'''Alli Jean Walker''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer, songwriter, and model from [[Summerside, Prince Edward Island]]. She is currently signed to Records Nashville.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sonymusic.ca/press_release/rising-country-star-alli-walker-signs-with-records-nashville|title=RISING COUNTRY STAR ALLI WALKER SIGNS WITH RECORDS NASHVILLE|work=[[Sony Music Canada]]|date=March 13, 2024|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref>\n\n==Early life==\nWalker grew up in [[Prince Edward Island]].  After learning the piano and drums, she learned how to play the [[bagpipes]], and attended several international bagpiping competitions. Walker turned down a scholarship to the [[University of Arkansas]], as she was inspired by [[Taylor Swift]] to pursue a career in [[country music]].<ref name=\"Spotlight\">{{cite web|url=https://spotlightonbusinessmagazine.com/in-the-spotlight-alli-walker-islander-brings-her-pipes-to-music-city/|title=In the spotlight \u2013 ALLI WALKER \u2013 Islander brings her Pipes to Music City|work=Spotlight on Business Magazine|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> She attended the [[University of Prince Edward Island]] for one year as a vocal major, but elected to drop out as the program was focused on classical training.<ref name=\"Spotlight\"/> In 2009, Walker moved to [[Toronto, Ontario]] to pursue a career in [[country music]] and modelling.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/prince-edward-island/pei-summerside-musician-mental-health-music-1.5142234|title=Summerside native Alli Walker on why she calls her music 'conscious country'|first=Tony|last=Davis|date=May 20, 2019|work=[[CBC News]]|access-date=May 19, 2024}}</ref><ref name=\"Notable\"/> She met her husband at a [[Rascal Flatts]] concert soon after moving to Toronto.<ref name=\"Notable\"/>\n\n==Career==\nAfter ten years of developing her music, Walker released her debut album ''The Basement Sessions: What I've Learned So Far'' on September 13, 2019.<ref name=\"Notable\">{{cite web|url=https://www.notablelife.com/meet-alli-walker-the-woman-taking-a-more-conscious-approach-to-country-music/|title=Meet Alli Walker, The Woman Taking a More Conscious Approach to Country Music|first=Lauren|last=Ramesbottom|work=Notable Life|access-date=May 19, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.saltwire.com/prince-edward-island/lifestyles/summerside-musician-alli-walker-releases-debut-cd-after-10-years-of-creating-it-362959/|title=Summerside musician Alli Walker releases debut CD after 10 years of creating it|date=October 12, 2019|newspaper=[[The Guardian (Charlottetown)|The Guardian]]|publisher=[[SaltWire Network]]|first=Sally|last=Cole|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> She recorded the songs in the basement of her home with her husband.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.elixuer.com/features/alli-walker-country-music-singer-songwriter-and-multi-instrumentalist/|first=Arslan|last=Ahmed|title=Alli Walker, Country Music Singer-Songwriter and Multi-Instrumentalist|date=January 20, 2022|work=Elixuer|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://procountrymusic.com/2019/04/11/alli-walker-finds-therapy-in-releasing-mindful-music/|title=Alli Walker Finds Therapy in Releasing \u201cMindful Music\u201d|work=Pro Country|date=April 11, 2019|access-date=August 12, 2024}}</ref>\n\nShortly thereafter, Walker and her husband moved to [[Kelowna, British Columbia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://kess11.medium.com/celebrating-her-small-town-roots-alli-walkers-home-town-home-c35abee46589|title=Celebrating Her Small Town Roots \u2014 Alli Walker\u2019s \u201cHome Town Home\u201d|first=Donna|last=Block|work=Medium|date=June 22, 2022|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> She subsequently released her second album ''Growing Up'' on March 10, 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/growing-up-p-e-i-country-artist-alli-walker-releases-her-most-personal-album-1.6335548|title=Growing Up: P.E.I. country artist Alli Walker releases her most personal album|first1=Natalie|last1=Lombard|first2=Katie|last2=Kelly|work=[[CTV News]] Atlantic|date=March 20, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-female-canadian-country-artist/|title=[SPOTLIGHT] Canadian Women Of Country: Alli Walker|first=Jenna|last=Weishar|work=Front Porch Music|date=April 6, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> The album included the single \"Red Wine or Whiskey\", and several previously released songs including \"Country Music\", \"Maybe I'm Still Drunk\", and a female point-of-view version of \"[[Sand in My Boots]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url= https://nowandthenmagazine.com/blogs/latest-news/posts/7167100/music-s-journey-podcast-interview-202-w-breakout-canadian-country-artist-alli-walker-just-released|title=Music's Journey Podcast INTERVIEW #202 w/ Breakout Canadian Country Artist Alli Walker Just Released Her New Single and Sophomore Album \u2018\u2019Growing Up''|work=Now and Then Magazine|date=March 10, 2023|location=[[Toronto, Ontario]]|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-sand-in-my-boots-morgan-wallen/|title= Alli Walker Responds to Morgan Wallen With \u201cSand In My Boots (Female POV)\u201d|work=Front Porch Music|date=December 9, 2022|first=Junior|last=Walker|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref>\n\nLater that year, Walker released the song \"The Whiskey's Gone\".<ref>{{cite web|url= https://canadianbeats.ca/2023/08/31/alli-walker-has-released-her-new-diddy-the-whiskeys-gone/|title=ALLI WALKER HAS RELEASED HER NEW DIDDY \u201cTHE WHISKEY\u2019S GONE\u201d|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|date=August 31, 2024|work=Canadian Beats Media|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> The song garnered significant attention on social media, and Walker subsequently moved with her husband to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], at the end of the year, and released the song \"Hung Up\".\n<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hotpress.com/music/watch-alli-walker-releases-music-video-to-accompany-her-hit-track-whiskeys-gone-22998589|title=Watch: Alli Walker releases music video to accompany her hit track 'Whiskey's Gone'|date=December 1, 2023|work=Hot Press|first=Niamh|last=Browne|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.raisedrowdy.com/2023/12/08/alli-walker-steps-into-her-next-chapter-with-hung-up/|title=Alli Walker Steps Into Her Next Chapter with \u2018Hung Up\u2019|work=Raised Rowdy|date=December 8, 2023|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> In March 2024, Walker signed her first record deal with RECORDS Nashville and released the single \"I Like Big Trucks\".<ref>{{cite web|url= https://frontporchmusic.ca/alli-walker-signs-major-deal-records-nashville/|title=Canadian Artist Alli Walker Signs Major Record Deal With RECORDS Nashville|date=March 12, 2024|first=Jenna|last=Weishar|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2024/03/alli-walker-signs-with-records-nashville/|title=Alli Walker Signs With RECORDS Nashville|first=Madison|last=Hahnen|work=Music Row Magazine|date=March 8, 2024|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://ca.billboard.com/music-news-digest-music-pei-awards-country-artist-alli-walker-signed-in-nashville-more|title=Music News Digest: Music PEI Awards, Country Artist Alli Walker Signed In Nashville & More|first=Kerry|last=Doole|date=March 13, 2024|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Canada|access-date=May 18, 2024}}</ref> In April 2024, Walker received a significant amount of media attention after she performed her song \"Creek\" at a [[Nashville Predators]] playoff hockey game and drank beer from the mouth of a dead [[catfish]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/sports/nhl/predators/2024/04/29/nashville-predators-alli-walker-beer-catfish/73500250007/|title=Who's the Nashville artist drinking beer from catfish at Predators playoff game?|first=Marcus K.|last=Dowling|work=[[Nashville Tennessean]]|date=April 29, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.si.com/nhl/2024/04/29/predators-alli-walker-chugs-beer-catfish|title=Singer Alli Walker Chugged a Beer From a Dead Catfish While Performing at Predators Game|work=[[Sports Illustrated]]|first=Stephen|last=Douglas|date=April 29, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.news.com.au/sport/sports-life/singer-performs-sickest-tradition-in-sport-goes-viral/news-story/dfea92b13f01333d89b71c1fa67fea5d|title=Singer performs sickest tradition in sport, goes viral|first=Tyson|last=Otto|work=[[News.com.au]]|date=May 3, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}</ref> A video of the incident was later shown on [[Hockey Night in Canada]] as well as an [[ESPN]] national broadcast in the United States.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://countrytown.com/news/alli-walker-does-a-shoey-out-of-a-catfish/QmD4VFdWWVg/11-05-24|title=Alli Walker Does A Shoey Out Of A Catfish|first=Mary|last=Varvaris|work=Countrytown|date=May 11, 2024|access-date=May 29, 2024}}</ref> Walker received a nomination for Female Artist of the Year at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]].<ref name=\"CCMA\"/>\n\n==Discography==\n===Studio albums===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\"\n|-\n! style=\"width:10em;\"| Title\n! style=\"width:16em;\"| Details\n|-\n! Brown\n|-\n| 2024\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Nashville\"<ref>{{cite web|title=Alli Walker - Nashville (Official Music Video)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ma3-ylkRa2U |website=[[YouTube]]|access-date=August 7, 2024|format=video|date=August 2, 2024}}</ref>\n| Justin Key\n|-\n|}\n\n==Awards and nominations==\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|+\n!Year\n!Association\n!Category\n!Nominated work\n!Result\n!Ref\n|-\n| 2024\n| [[Canadian Country Music Association]]\n| Female Artist of the Year\n| {{n/a}}\n| {{pending}}\n| <ref name=\"CCMA\">{{cite web|url=https://ccma.org/2024-ccma-award-nominees/|title=2024 CCMA AWARDS NOMINEES|work=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]|access-date=July 19, 2024|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20240719164229/http://web.archive.org/screenshot/https://ccma.org/2024-ccma-award-nominees/|archive-date=July 19, 2024}}</ref>\n|-\n|}\n\n==References==\n{{Reflist|30em}} \n\n==External links==\n*{{Official website|https://www.alliwalker.com/}}\n\n{{Authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Walker, Alli}}\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:1989 births]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian people]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian singers]]\n[[Category:21st-century Canadian singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:Canadian country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:People from Summerside, Prince Edward Island]]\n[[Category:Singers from Prince Edward Island]]\n[[Category:Sony Music artists]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes.
